column4: I am doing this command but I am getting an error that I don't have permissions even with sudo any suggestions? echo 'pwcheck_method: saslauthd' >> /etc/postfix/sasl/smtpd.conf
you're running the echo under sudo, but the piped results are being written as the regular user...that's a time when being root somes in handy
if I become root now will it cause conflicts with the echo commands that I did as sudo?
if I become root now will it cause conflicts with the echo commands that I did as sudo? How do I sign in as root? I have never done that?
